1.title: Action
1.content: Action. You can see action used in various modules and add new action details manually or import complete file contain list of action name and their details. Also, edit existing action's detail in the system for futher use. . "Action" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the venders. . . You can search for the action(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find action list in the table. . . You can edit the particular action detail from the system by double clicking on the respective row of the table. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular action including action name, action short name, action description, action URL. You can edit any field by clicking on them. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . You can also add new role by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new action in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . Click on “Import” button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. </p> . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Action Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the module name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you select module name it will auto fill some fields like Action Short Name, Action Descriptio, Action Url. You have to fill that too. | . Action Short Name | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Code should be in captial letters always. | . Action Description | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it | . Action Url | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it | . Is Active | Switch (Toggle) Button | Yes | Yes/No | .

2.title: Admissions
2.content: Admissions. In 'Admissions' section you can see all the admissions done in the lounge on which date, in which outlet, from which airlines, etc. . "Admissions" tab is accessiable from the sidebar. Click on it to get in-depth data view of the admissions. . . You can search for the admission(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find admissions list in the table. . . You can view admission's details by double click on that row of the table for whose details you want to see. . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular order including admission number, member ID, flight no, airlines, outlet name, etc. .

3.title: Admission Instruction
3.content: Admission Instruction. You can add new tokens manually or import complete file containing list of Admission Instructions and their details. Also, edit existing Admission Instruction's details in the system for futher use. . "Admission Instruction" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the Admission Instructions. . . You can search for the Admission Instruction(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find Admission Instructions list in the table. . . You can download the file of Admission Instructions by clicking on download icon in the "Action" column of table. . . You can view Admission Instruction's details by double click on that row of the table for whose details you want to see. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular Admission Instruction including Admission Instruction name, type, category, partner name, etc. . . Also, you can see seven horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Token Identification, Applicable At, Entitlements, Documents Required, Token Samples, Generate/Import Tokens, Localisation. . . By default "Token Identification" data is visible, where you can see the mask patterns, issuing country and other details related to tokens. . . You can find the table for exisitng tokens. . . You can also delete the pattern by clicking on trash icon in the particular row of table. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Pattern" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new patterns by clicking on "Add Pattern" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to add new pattern. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset form values. . . Click on "Add Pattern" to save the information. . . Click on "Applicable At" tab to view, edit or new add applicable at in the system. . . You can find the table of existing bin ranges and outlet details. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Search can be done on the basis of outlet name, country and continent . . User can shift all the outlets in one go by clicking on double arrows and vice versa . . If user want to select it one by one then they can either double click on the outlets or after single click they can press forward arrow and vice versa. . . Click on "Add Applicable At" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new bin range by clicking on "Add Applicable At" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can click on dropdown arrow to see all the bin ranges. . . you can select the bin range for which the token is applicable at. . . After clicking on the bin range, you can see available outlets and selected outlets for which you can search by using outlet name, . After clicking on the bin range, you can see select outlets from available outltes with help of search. . Click on "Entitlements" tab to view, edit or new entitlements. . . You can find the table of entitlements. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Add Entitlements" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new entitlements by clicking on "Add New Entitlements" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the bin range to add new entitlement in the system. . . Click on "Select Outlets" to select outlet. . . Select outlet window will popup from it you can select outlets from available outlets . . Once you select the outlet clock on "Close" button to close the popup window. . . Fill the entitlement for the outlets and click on "Add Entitlement" button. The entitlements will get added to selected outlets. . <!– . Click on "Add Entitlements" to add new entitlements. . –> . Click on "Documents Required" tab to view the existing documents in the system. . . You can find the table for existing documents. . . Click on checkbox(es) in row of the table which document you want to save for that token. . . Click on "ADD Documents" button to save/update the documents for the token. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the selected documents. . . Click on "Token Samples" tab to view, delete or add new sample images for the token. . . You can find the sample images for tokens. . . Hover on any image and you will find the delete(trash) icon, click on it if you want to delete that image. . . You can also add new sample image(s) by clicking on "Add New Token Sample" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can upload single/multiple image for tokens in the system. . <!– <p>Click on “Generate/Import Token” tab to view, edit or add new token.</p> . You can find the table of generated tokens. . . You can delete token by clicking on the delete icon present in the "Action" column of table. . –> <!– <p>Double click on the any row to view its detailed information.</p> . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Token ID" to save the edited fields changes. . –> <!– <p> You can also add new token ID by clicking on “Add New Token ID” button present on the top of the table. </p> . In this screen, you can fill the required details to add new token ID in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Token ID" to save the data. . –> . Click on "Localisation" tab to view the data in different languages. . . You can find the table for existing attributes. . . Enter the token name in Chinese . . Click on "Save" to save the data. . . From the header change the language to Chinese . . Here we can see the name has changed to Chinese. . . If language Changed back to English . . The token name will be chnaged back to English . . You can also add new token by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new token in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save Draft" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Clone Token" button to clone(copy) of the token in draft mode, which you can edit. . . Once you click on it, it will open the popup for you. Click on "Yes" button to make the copy of the token. . . Else, click on "No" button. . <!– <p> Click on “Import” button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. </p> . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . –> . QR Code Admission Instruction . Select "QR Code" from Admission Instruction type. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Save Draft" button to Save the details. . . After clicking on save draft, horizontal tabs will be visible.you can see in the details page below the form fields - Token Identification, Applicable At, Entitlements, Documents Required, Token Samples, Generate/Import Tokens, Localisation. . . In Token Identification, click on "Add pattern" . . Fill the details, Coupon contains will populate the partner short code (but this is editable) . . Click on "Add Pattern" to save the pattern . . Click on "Applicable At" tab to view, edit or new add applicable at in the system. . . Click on "Add Applicable At" to bind outlets to the token. . . Select the bin range for which the token is applicable at. . . You can search the outlet in the search field on the basis or outlet name, country, continent in available outlets and pass it to selected outlet using single forward arrow or you cab double click on the outlet. . . You can see in the following screen that the outlet is moved to selected outlet. . . Once you select all the outlets, Click on "Add Applicable At" . . Once you click on Add Appplicable at, You can see the details as shown below . . Click on "Entitlements" tab to view, edit or new entitlements. . . Click on "Add Entitlement" to add entitlemets to selected outlets. . . Select the Bin Range for which toke is created . . After selecting the Bin Range, click on "Select Outlets" to select the outlet . . After clicking on Select outlets pop up window will appear from which we can select the outlet from available outlet either by doubble clicking on outlet or by selecting outlet and move it to selected outlet with help of single forward arrow. . . The outlet should be in the "selected outlet" as shown in below . . Click on "Close" button to close the pop up window. . . Fill the Entitlemnts Details For the selected outlets and click on "Add Entitlement" button . . The entitlments can be seen as shown below table. . . Next Tab is "Generate/Import Coupons", in which you can import coupon, generate coupon and view coupon . . Click on "Import Coupon" to import coupons. . . Follow the steps as mentioned below for "Select file" tab . . Click on choose file to select excel file to upload. Then "upload" button will enable. Click on "Upload" for next steps. . . Next tab is "Match Headers". If there is no error then click on Continue. . . Next tab is "Confirm Data".Click on "Import" button . . Next Tab is "Generate Coupon" to generate a coupon. . . Select the coupon from "Coupon Contains" . . Count will notify how many coupons are generated (Select 1 to create one coupon) . . Once you fill all the fields, click on "Generate Coupon" . . The generated coupon will be shown on Token Screen and one entry will be shown in the table. Also, by clicking on View Coupon the user can view the coupon details . .

4.title: Port/Station
4.content: Port/Station. You can add multiple port/station directly by importing complete file containing list of port/station and their details. . "Port/Station" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the ports/stations. . . You can search for the port(s)/station(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find port/station list in the table. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. .

5.title: API Documentation
5.content: Features . You can check the features of the entire system by following below mentioned points of PPG LMS: . Login | Profile | Change Password | List | Card Save | Verify Token | Boarding Pass Scan | Boarding Pass Save | Boarding Pass ID | Corporate Tokens | Corporates | Redeem Coupon | Get Facilities | Get Products | Get Orderes | Get Outlets | Get Entitlements | Get Admission | Blacklisted Token | Whitelisted Token | Map Outlets | Map Products | Get Token | Get Coupon Code | Get Coupon Details | Cancel Coupon | Redeeem Coupon | Update Coupon |

6.title: Blacklisted Token
6.content: Blacklisted Token . This API allows publisher/partner to get blacklisted token by using the parameters mentioned below: . { "token": 234568777799, "tokenType": "Vouchers", "startDate":"08-03-2022", "endDate":"08-04-2022" } . Request URL . POST: https://dev-us-lms-backendapi.plaza-network.com/api/fe/v1/plaza/lms/blacklistedToken . Parameters Description . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . token | Number | Mandatory* | User can get details only about specifin token. This is created at the time of admission. | . Token type | Options | Mandatory* | Tells you the type of admission it is, like QR code, credit card, boarding pass. | . startDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order starting from the mentioned date. | . endDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order till the mentioned date. | . Responses . Success: . { "status": 0, "tag": " /v1/api/plaza/lms/blacklistedToken", "input": { "token": 234568777799, "tokenType": "Vouchers", "startDate": "08-03-2022", "endDate": "08-04-2022" }, "result": "", "description": "token could not found" } .

7.title: Boarding Pass ID
7.content: Boarding Pass ID . This API allows publisher/partner enter boarding pass by id: . Request URL . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . isManual | Boolean | Optional* | | . createTime | Date | Mandatory* | This is date and time of creation of boarding pass. | . flightFrom | string | Optional* | This is country code from where flight departure. | . flightTo | string | Optional* | This is city code where flight landed. | . fromCity | string | Optional* | This is city code where flight landed. | . toCity | string | Optional* | This is city code where flight landed. | . airlineCode | string | Optional* | This is airline code under which that flight belongs. | . flightNumber | Number | Optional* | This is a unique number provided to every flight. | . classCode | string | Optional* | This is the code of class in which user travel in flight | . dateOfFlight | Date | Optional* | This is the date of journey. | . seatNumber | string | Optional* | This is seat number aloted to user. | . airlineNumericCode | Number | Optional* | This is airline code in numbers. | . id | string | Mandatory* | This is unique id of users boarding pass. | . 17.title: Country
17.content: Country . You can onboard new country manually or import complete file containing list of country and their details. Also, edit existing country's details in the system for futher use. . "Country" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the countries. . . You can search for the country by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find country list in the table. . . You can edit/view the particular country from the system by double click on the row of the table. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular country including country name, language and currency. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Save" button to save the edited/New fields. . . You can also add new country by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new country in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Country Name | Free text | Yes | You have to fill it yourself. | . Country language | Free Text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Currency | Free text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Status | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select country name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Status could have following values - Active, Inactive | .

18.title: Dashboard
18.content: Dashboard . In 'Dashboard' section you can see everything related to the system at one page like orders, members, admissions, today's count, top selling products, partner names, etc. . "Dashbaord" tab is open by default once you logged in the system. Else, it is accessiable from the sidebar. Click on it to get in-depth data view of the entire system. . . In top left section, you can see the count of the users, partners, orders and product. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In the right of it, you can see the members currently present in the lounge and the count of current Admission Instructions. . . In "Today's Count in Lounge" you can see the line graph based on timings. You can see the number of persons available in any particular hour of the day. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Top Selling Products" you can see the doughnut graph which represents the top 5 selling products in the lounge with its count. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Total Sales" you can see the bar graph where you can see the sales per month. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Top 3 Facilities" you can see the top facilities provided in the lounge like Spa Service, Meeting Area and Kids Area were the top facilities or can say maximum person take these facilities. . . In "Visit by Admission Instruction Name" you can see the piechart where you can figure out by which mode you got the admissions including their count. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Visit by Partner Name" you can see the piechart which helps you in telling that how many persons visiting your lounge with the particular partner. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . .

19.title: Devices
19.content: Devices . You can add new devices manually or import complete file containing list of devices and their details. Also, edit existing device's details in the system for futher use. . "Devices" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the devices. . . You can search for the device(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find devices list in the table. . . You can view device's details by double click on that row of the table for whose details you want to see. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular device including device name, type, serial no, available at outlet, etc. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited information. . . Click on "Save" button to save the edited information. . . You can also add new device by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new device in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Device Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the device name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you have selected any device from the dropdown or write its name, you will see some of the fields get auto filled. | . Device Type | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select device name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Headphones, Laptop, Mobile. | . Serial No | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select device name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Enter the serial number you want to give to your device. | . Available At Outlet | Free text with dropdown | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You have to enter starting three alphabets of the outlet name and it will show you the result based on that. | . Device Category | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select device name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Category could have following values - Primary, Secondary, Temporary. | . Device Brand | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select device name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Brand could have following values - Apple, Boat. | . Device Tag | Selection(Multiple) | Yes | System generated once you select device name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You can give(select) multiple tags to the device. | . Is Active | Switch(toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | .

Dashboard | Admissions | Orders | Catalog | Partner Responses | File Import/Export | Partner | Outlet | Product | Admission Instruction | Partner Contract | Airport | Users | Members | Devices | Vendor | Tax | Country | Pincode | ReceiptTemplate | Token | Module | Action | Role | Global Settings |

21.title: File Import/Export
21.content: File Import/Export . You can import complete file and view existing files's errors details in the system. . "File Import/Export" tab is accessiable. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the files. . . You can search for the file(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find files list in the table. . . You can view file's errors in detail by double click on that row of the table for whose errors you want to see. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the errors list in the table including column name, row no, column no, etc. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. .

32.title: Getting Started
32.content: PPG LMS . PPG LMS is the system where you can handle all the operations related to different or multiple lounges in different or same Airport. . Here you can view, manage or add new users, members, Admission Instructions, partners, outlets, products, airports, devices. It will help you to easily handle each and every operation realted to lounge in efficient manner. . User have to follow the steps while using the system: . User have to login to the system. You can login using your google or facebook account also. . If you are using the system for the first time then click on "Sign Up" link. . Then, fill the following details to create your account. . If user, forgot the password then click on "Forgot Password" link. . The system opens the modal where you can enter your email address and click on "Continue" button. The link send to your email id by using it you can reset your password. . Click on "Return to Login" link to get back to login page. . Once, user login in to the system. He/She will handle/see the screens which they want to work on. .

38.title: New LMS User Setup
38.content: New LMS User Setup . User Sign-up: Self sign-up by using his details. After successful sign-up user, Cognito creates user in "contractor user pool". A LMS webhook is called from Cognito to create new user in the system. After that, admin will add outlets to that user and assign some roles. Now, user can log in via Cognito. . User Sign-in: You will go the sign-in page. After successful sign-in using cognito, LMS login API will be called using JWT. This checks if user exists in the system or not. User authorization is checked for an outlet based on roles assigned. If not authorized, user will be redirected to login page. On successful authorization, user will be able to login to the system. Now based on roles assigned, user can perform certain operations in LMS. . Sign-in-Process: . To "Sign-In" or "Sign-Up",Go to "https://market-api.com" . 1. If you do not have an account , click on Sign-up link. . 2. Fill the required information and click on Sign-up button. . Note: After Sign-up ,user can only "Sign-In" once's ,the user is confirm from AWS console by the admin and role(s) ,outlet(s) are assigned(in LMS). . 3. Admin will click-on "Sign In to the console button" ,in AWS console and login to the system. . 4. In Sign-In option click on root-user and enter the credentials. . 5. Click on "Cognito". . 6. Click on "Manage User Pools". . 7. Click on "plazauserconfirme". . 8. Click on "Users and groups" . . 9. Search for newly created user enter the user name in the input field and press enter to search newly created user. . 10. Click on "Confirm-button" to confirm the user . . Note: Now the user is confirmed by the admin. . 11. In the "Master User screen"(LMS) ,newly created user is found on the top,double click on the newly created user to assign role(s) and outlet(s). . 12. Click on "Roles tab", to assign role(s) to the user. . 13. Click on "Outlet access tab", to assign outlet(s) to the user. . 14. Select the "Outlet" assign to the user. . 14. Click on "add user to outlet" button at the bottom. . 15. Now the user is ready to "Sign-in",enter the credentials and click on Sign-in button . . 16. After the successful Sign-In user can access the LMS(homepage) . . User sync-up process: At the interval of every 15 mins, LMS will check cognito for user data updates. Based on the data received, user will be made active or inactive. .

39.title: Offline Partner Integration
39.content: Offline File based Integration with Partners . . If a new Partner wants to share files for Integration, the same is conveyed to the admin and the following process is followed. . Admin (outside LMS ) set up FTP Server Access for that partner and share the same to the partner. | LMS admin creates new partner in the LMS | Partner Settings are setup for the file shared by partner which are described below in detail | Partner Admission Instruction(AI)/ Admission Instruction is defined. | A Partner Contract is set up for the Admission Instructions. | File Integration is used in the Admissions Process. | . Partner Settings . Partner settings depend on the file type (i.e.) Inbound and Outbound, also each setting contains different key values explained below. . ● Process File Type - It defines which file types will be processed for a particular partner. File can be of following types. Whitelisting File (WL) | Blacklisting File (BL) | Outbound File (OUT) | . | This setting is named Process_File_type and under this we set key1 to declare the file types. . Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Process_File_type | WL,BL, OUT | | | | | . How to set Keys? . Key1 will be set with the comma separated abbreviations for file type, like if for a particular partner integration only whitelisting file and outbound file are there, then key1 will be set to WL, OUT. . Key2, Key3, Key4, Key5 are left blank. . . Inbound Settings . Parsing Implementation Class - This setting is about implementation details of the given file, which can be of two types Comma Separated Values (CSV) - It is a plain text file that contains a list of data which is separated by either comma or tab space. | Fixed Width (Flat File) - It is a plain text file where each field value is the same width and padded with spaces. It is much easier to read than CSV files but takes up more space than CSV | . | Setting named Parsing_Impl_Class_{process_file_type} is used to parse implementation class and key1, key2 are set to implement this. . Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Process_File_type | WL,BL, OUT | | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Parsing_Impl_Class_{process_file_type} will be Parsing_Impl_Class_WL if the Processing file type is Whitelisting File, similarly Parsing_Impl_Class_BL for blacklisting file. . How to set Keys? . Key1 - csvImportService( If the Implementation class is CSV) fixedimportService ( If the Implementation class is Fixed Width) . Key2 - Is set only if Key1 is csvImportService and in this case Key2 defines whether the data will be comma separated (commaBasedSplitter) or tab separated (tabBasedSplitter) and in case of fixedimportService key2 will be empty. . Key3, key4, key5 left blank . SFTP Details - SFTP details are provided under this setting as | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} | sftp_path | hostname | username | encrypted password | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_WL for whitelisting files and likewise for others. . How to set Keys? . Key1 holds SFTP path like for example /root_folder/offline/inbound/SBIN_WL/ . This path will point to the folder where the file will be uploaded. . key2 holds the hostname, . key3 holds username . key4 holds the encrypted password. Encryption is done using DESEDE_ENCRYPTION_SCHEME. . Key5 left blank . SFTP File Type - this setting is about the file format and their encryption/decryption details as | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} | gpg/zip | Public_key / private_key | encrypted password | txt | fileextentionexist / fileextentionnotexist | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_WL for whitelisting files and likewise for others. . How to set Keys? . Key1 - It describes the extension of the encrypted file that can be either .gpg file or .zip file . Key2 - It is set with the private key / public key name . Key3 - It contains the encryption password. Encryption is done using DESEDE_ENCRYPTION_SCHEME. . Key4 - contains the extension of the file . Key5 - It is set to either fileextensionexist or fileextentionnotexist. if it is fileextensionexist then the key4 data is taken into consideration else not Example - suppose there is a file name ABA_PPL_IN_20220412.txt.gpg, in this case key5 is set to fileextensionexist and in ABBPPRLP-20220411.gpg, key5 is set to fileextentionnotexist . Data Ingestion Webhook - A webhook is a way for one application to deliver data to another app in real-time. This setting defines Webhook Url for each card detail which is inserted | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Data_Ingestion_Webhook_{process_file_type} | webhook_url | | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_WL for whitelisting files and likewise for others. . How to set Keys? . Set the URL under Key1 . Password Protected Data - This is set if the data is password protected | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . PasswordProtectedData_{process_file_type} | yes/no | encrypted password | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_WL for whitelisting files and likewise for others. . How to set Keys? . Key2 is set in case key1 is set yes . Header - This setting is about header information, if it exists or not and the values passed to it, length of the data size, padding and all. | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . IsHeaderAvailable_{process_file_type} | yes/no | Titles | any number | left/right | space /tab | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_WL for whitelisting files and likewise for others. . How to set Keys? . Key1 - defines whether header will be shown in file or not. It is set to either Yes or No. . Key2 - Defines the header values separated by comma/tab for csv file type and fixed spaces for fixed length file type Example- Sno,IssuingRegion,Region,Airport,Outlet,Client_Type,Client_Name,Account_Name,Card_Name,Receipt_Number,Quota_Config,Transaction_Date,Transaction_Time,Customer_Name,CardNumber,Service_Location,Service_Item . Key3 - length of data size used in case of fixed length (can be any number depending on how many characters are needed to show) . Key4 - defines whether padding will be provided on the left or right. . Key5 - defines whether the space will be filled by tab or space. . Parsing Rule Json - It sets up the rules for data validation. The file gets parsed only if it passes these rules, and these rules may be different for each partner. | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Parsing_Rule_Json_{process_file_type} | Parsing_Rule_Json | Key_mapping | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_WL for whitelisting files and likewise for others. . How to set Keys? . Key1 is set with json code. Sample is shown below { "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#", "title": "Product", "description": "A product from the catalog", "type": "object", "properties": { "STARTDATE": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^ d{4}- d{2}- d{2}$" }, "CARDNUMBER": { "type": "string", "minLength": 16, "maxLength": 16 }, "OldCardNumber": { "type": "string", "minLength": 16, "maxLength": 16 }, "VALIDTILL": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^ d{4}- d{2}- d{2}$" }, "SQ": { "type": "string" } }, "required": ["STARTDATE", "CARDNUMBER", "VALIDTILL"] } . All the data under the partner file should validate wrt the properties defined in this Parsing_Rule_Json. Like if data under CARDNUMBER in the file doesn’t have the string data type and minLength=maxLength = 16, data validation will be failed and the file will not get parsed. So, the data types, patterns, datalength and some other properties are defined under this which are mandatory to pass. . Key2 - This key maps the header name to the database name. Like below is the example { "CARDHOLDER_NO": "CARDNUMBER", "No of Access":"NO_OF_ACCESS" } . Here, CARDNUMBER will be mapped to the CARDHOLDER_NO in database . . Outbound Settings . File Frequency - It defines file regeneration cycle duration and next scheduled date and setup as below | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . File_Frequency_{Process_File_type} | 30 / 12 | 9/8/2022 0:00:00 | 9/7/2022 0:00:00 | 1 / 2 | | . How to set Setting Name? . File_Frequency_{Process_File_type} will be File_Frequency_OUT if the Processing file type is Outbound Files. . How to set Keys? . Key1 - shows the number of days or months based on the Key4 and basically set as a cycle period. If key4 is set 1 that means Key1 contains the number of days and if key4 is set 2 that means key1 contains number of days. . Key2 - This key is set with the next scheduled datetime. . Key3 - This key shows Last Run datetime. . Key4 - as mentioned under Key1 it signifies that what type of data value is set in key1 . Parsing Implementation Class - This setting is about implementation details of the given file, which can be of two types Comma Separated Values (CSV) - It is a plain text file that contains a list of data which is separated by either comma or tab space. | Fixed Width (Flat File) - It is a plain text file where each field value is the same width and padded with spaces. It is much easier to read than CSV files but takes up more space than CSV | . | Setting named Parsing_Impl_Class_{process_file_type} is used to parse implementation class and key1, key2 are set to implement this. . Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Parsing_Impl_Class_{process_file_type} | csvExportService / fixedExportService | tabBasedSplitter / commaBasedSplitter | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Parsing_Impl_Class_{process_file_type} will be Parsing_Impl_Class_OUT if the Processing file type is Outbound File. . How to set Keys? . Key1 - csvExportService ( If the Implementation class is CSV) fixedExportService( If the Implementation class is Fixed Width) . Key2 - Is set only if Key1 is csvExportService and in this case Key2 defines whether the data will be comma separated (commaBasedSplitter) or tab separated (tabBasedSplitter) and in case of fixedExportService key2 will be empty. . Key3, key4, key5 left blank . SFTP Details - SFTP details are provided under this setting as | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} | sftp_path | hostname | username | encrypted password | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_OUT for OUTBound Files. . How to set Keys? . Key1 holds SFTP path, key2 holds the hostname, key3 holds username and key4 holds the password. . SFTP File Type - this setting is about the file format and their encryption details | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} | gpg/zip | Public_key / private_key | encrypted password | txt | fileextentionexist / fileextentionnotexist | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_OUT for OUTBound Files. . How to set Keys? . Key1 - It describes the extension of the encrypted file that can be either .gpg file or .zip file . Key2 - It is set with the private key / public key name . Key3 - It contains the encryption password. Encryption is done using DESEDE_ENCRYPTION_SCHEME. . Key4 - contains the extension of the file . Key5 - It is set to either fileextensionexist or fileextentionnotexist. if it is fileextensionexist then the key4 data is taken into consideration else not Example - suppose there is a file name ABA_PPL_IN_20220412.txt.gpg, in this case key5 is set to fileextensionexist and in ABBPPRLP-20220411.gpg, key5 is set to fileextentionnotexist . Data Ingestion Webhook - A webhook is a way for one application to deliver data to another app in real-time. This setting define Webhook Url for each card detail which is inserted | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Data_Ingestion_Webhook_{process_file_type} | webhook_url | | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_OUT for OUTBound Files. . How to set Keys? . Set the URL under Key1 . PostData Ingestion Webhook - This define Webhook Url for every file detail | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Postdata_Ingestion_Webhook_{process_file_type} | webhook_url | | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_OUT for OUTBound Files. . How to set Keys? . Set the URL under Key1 . Password Protected Data - This is set if the data is password protected | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . PasswordProtectedData_{process_file_type} | yes/no | encrypted password | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_OUT for OUTBound Files. . How to set Keys? . Key2 is set in case key1 is set yes . Header - this setting is about header information, if it exists or not and the values passed to it, length of the data size, padding and all. | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . IsHeaderAvailable_{process_file_type} | yes/no | Titles separated by comma | any number | left/right | space /tab | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_OUT for OUTBound Files. . How to set Keys? . Key1 - defines if the header will be shown in the outbound file or not. It is set to either Yes or No. . Key2 - Defines the header values Example- Sno,IssuingRegion,Region,Airport,Outlet,Client_Type,Client_Name,Account_Name,Card_Name,Receipt_Number,Quota_Config,Transaction_Date,Transaction_Time,Customer_Name,CardNumber,Service_Location,Service_Item . Key3 - length of data size used in case of fixed length (can be any number depending on how many characters are needed to show) . Key4 - - defines whether padding will be provided on the left or right. . Key5 - defines whether the space will be filled by tab or space. . Parsing Rule Json - This setting set up the rules for data validation. The file gets parsed only if it passes these rules, and these rules may be different for each partner. | Setting Name Key1 Key2 Key3 Key4 Key5 . Parsing_Rule_Json_{process_file_type} | Parsing_Rule_Json | Key_mapping | | | | . How to set Setting Name? . Setting name will be processed the same as mentioned in case of Parsing_Impl_Class like SFTPDetail_{process_file_type} is SFTPDetail_OUT for OUTBound Files. . How to set Keys? . Key1 is set with json code. Sample is shown below { "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#", "title": "Product", "description": "A product from the catalog", "type": "object", "properties": { "STARTDATE": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^ d{4}- d{2}- d{2}$" }, "CARDNUMBER": { "type": "string", "minLength": 16, "maxLength": 16 }, "OldCardNumber": { "type": "string", "minLength": 16, "maxLength": 16 }, "VALIDTILL": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^ d{4}- d{2}- d{2}$" }, "SQ": { "type": "string" } }, "required": ["STARTDATE", "CARDNUMBER", "VALIDTILL"] } . All the data under the partner file should validate wrt the properties defined in this Parsing_Rule_Json file. Like if data under CARDNUMBER in the file doesn’t have the string data type and minLength=maxLength = 16, data validation will be failed and the file will not get parsed. So, the data types, patterns, datalength and some other properties are defined under this which are mandatory to pass. . Key2 - This key maps the header name to the database name. Like below is the example { "CARDHOLDER_NO": "CARDNUMBER", "No of Access":"NO_OF_ACCESS" } . Here, CARDNUMBER will be mapped to the CARDHOLDER_NO in database . .

40.title: Orders
40.content: Orders . You can check the orders list with its each and every detail which have been placed till date. . "Orders" tab is accessiable from the sidebar. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the orders. . . You can search for the order(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find orders list in the table. . . You can view order's details by double click on that row of the table for whose details you want to see. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular order including order number, amount, partner name, admission number, Admission Instruction, etc. . . You can also see the items list which has been placed in that particular order. . . Click on "Close" button to close the order's details page. . .

41.title: Outlet
41.content: Outlet . You can add new partners manually or import complete file containing list of outlets and their details. Also, edit existing outlet's details in the system for futher use. . "Outlet" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the outlets. . . You can search for the outlet(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find outlets list in the table. . . You can view outlet's details by double click on that row of the table for whose details you want to see. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular outlet including outlet name, type, category, address, etc. . . Also, you can see four horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Outlet Photos, Users, Outlet Timings, Localisation. . . By default "Outlet Photos" data is visible, where you can see the photos of the outlet or can add new ones. . . You can see the available photos of the outlet in the system. . . You can also add new photos by clicking on "Add New Outlet Photos" button present on the top of the outlet images. . . In this screen, you can upload the photos of the outlet. . . Click on "Reset" button to delete the uploaded photos. . . Click on "Add Outlet Photos" to save the uploaded photos. . . Click on "Users" tab to view, edit or new add users for the outlet. . . You can find the table of existing users. . <!– <p>Double click on the any row to view its detailed information.</p> . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add User" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new user by clicking on "Add New User" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to add new user for the outlet. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add User" to save the data. . –> . Click on "Outlet Timings" tab to view, edit or new timings for the outlet. . . You can find the table of currently running timings for the outlet. . . You can also add new timings by clicking on "Add New Timings" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details like a switch button for every day which represents on which the outlet is closed/open and timings (opening and closing) for each day specifically for the outlet. . . You can also add multiple timings for single day by clicking on "Add Hours" link. . . It will open another field each time you click on "Add Hours" option. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Timings" to save the data. . . Click on "Localisation" tab to view the data in different languages. . . You can find the table for existing attributes. . . Click on "Save" to save the data. . . You can also add new outlet by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new outlet in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Outlet Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the outlet name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you have selected any outlet from the dropdown, you will see some of the fields get auto filled. | . Outlet Category | Selection | Yes | Category could have following values - PPG, Third Party, Project | . Outlet Code | View only | - | System generated | . Outlet Type | Selection | Yes | Type could have following values - Lounge, Spa, Salon, Kids Area, Bar, F&B | . Outlet Brand | Selection | Yes | Brand could have following values - PPG, ST | . Outlet Owned By | Selection | Yes | Name of the owner of the outlet | . Outlet Operated By | Free text | Yes | Name of the person who is operating things in that outlet | . Parent Lounge | View only | - | System generated | . Business Line | Selection | Yes | Business Line could have following values - Lounge, Spa, F&B | . Address Line 1 | Free text | Yes | Enter the address of the outlet | . Address Line 2 | Free text | No | Enter the address of the outlet | . Port | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the port and it will show you the result based on that. | . Journey | Selection | Yes | Journey could have following values - Domestic & International | . Travel Direction | Selection | Yes | Travel Direction could have following values - Arrival & Departure | . Terminal Code | Free text | Yes | From Airport Configuration | . Sub Termial | Free text | No | If the terminal has multiple locations, then either use the gate code, or any other indication to reflect sub location within the terminal | . Zone | Selection | Yes | Zone could have following values - Before Security, After Security, In Transit | . Capacity | Number | Yes | Number of people allowed (sitting area) at a time in outlet | . IsActive | Switch (Toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | . Is Secured | Switch (Toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | . Secured By | Selection | Yes | Secured By could have following values - Lock and Key, Admission Instruction, E-Gate Pass, None | . Base Currency | Selection | Yes | ISO Code of currency. Currently currency could have following values - USD, YEN | . Date of Opening | Date | Yes | Date of opening of outlet | . Phone No | Number | Yes | Phone number of the outlet | . Fax | Free text | No | Fax number of the outlet | . Comment | Free text | Yes | Enter comment if you want to add for the outlet | . Outlet Photo | Upload | No | You can upload multiple photos of the outlet | . Outlet Timings | Switch(toggle) button and time | No | You can close/open day for the outlet by clicking on switch button. And add multiple opening/closing timings for the outlet | . Localisation | Free text | No | You can add attributes in different languages | .

42.title: Overview
42.content: Overview . Welcome to PPG LMS. This is the quick overview of the system that gives the arial view of the features. . Just after you login there is the dashboard screen that gives the overall status of the system. . On Dashboard you can see some key stats such as number of users, partners, orders, and products etc. You can also see the current count of members and Admission Instructions in the lounge. . Dashboard have some stats with visual representation of data in forms of ghraphs and charts. Some of these are: Today's count in lounge, Top selling products, Total sales, Visit by Admission Instruction name, and Visit by partner name etc. At some places the data is grouped while visualised for better understanding of the ratio. You can filter these stats with dropdowns having options for last week, month, year and all time. . On the left side navbar, there are many items that can help you to navigate to specific sreens to see and manage things in detail. . In admission, see the list of admissions for the lounge service. Each entry has some key information attached to it. . Orders section contains the list of orders received for a lounge. More details can be viewed for a particular order. . Partner responses contains responses list from partners for a given outlet. Every response has some metadata associated with it. . Adding each record to the system can be very time consuing at time. To save time, go to File Import/Export section and import data from sheets with just few click. You can export the data out if needed. . Masters section has a sub-menu which contains many options that you can manage. These are Partners, Outlets, Products, Admission Instructions, Partner Contracts, Airports, Users, Members, and Devices. You can list, manage or add new entries for these masters. This is just an overview of what you can manage with PPG LMS. For more details about each section, please refer to the related documentation page. .

43.title: Partner
43.content: Partner . You can onboard new partners manually or import complete file containing list of partners and their details. Also, edit existing partner's details in the system for futher use. . "Partner" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the partners. . . You can search for the partner(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find partners list in the table. . . There is "AI Generate" Column in the below table, After clicking on AI generate icon. It will download a PDF File, which contains all detail information of that created token. . . You can edit/delete the particular partner from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular partner. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular partners information. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular partner including partner name, type, category, region, etc. . . There is a clipboard icon next to partner name, With the help of this icon you can copy the database Partner ID. . . Also, you can see two horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Partner Entities and Contacts. . . By default "Partner Entities" data is visible, where you can see the table of partner entities. . . You can edit/delete the particular entity from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular entity. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular entities information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Entity" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new entity by clicking on "Add Entity" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to add new entity in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Entity" to save the data. . . Click on "Contacts" tab to view partners contact information. . . You can edit/delete the particular contact from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular contact. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular contact information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Contact" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new contact by clicking on "Add New Contact" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to add new contact in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Contact" to save the data. . . Click on "Partner Settings" button to view/edit the settings. . . The popup will open for you where you can view/edit the partners settings. . . Click on "Close" button to close the popup. . . Click on "Add Partner Settings" button to add new partner settings. . . Click on "Save" button to save the save the edited information. . . You can also add new partner by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new partner in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Partner Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the partner name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you select partner name it will auto fill some fields like Partner Type, Partner Category, Tax Identification number, Partner Short Code, Status and also open Partner Entity and contact forms. You have to fill that too. | . Partner Type | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select partner name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Financial Institution, Corporated, Lounge Programs. | . Partner Category | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select partner name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Category could have following values - International, Domestic | . Tax Identification No | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select partner name. Also, you can fill it yourself. | . Status | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select partner name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Status could have following values - Active, Inactive | . Partner Short Code | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select partner name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Code should be in captial letters always. | . Region | Selection | No | Region could have following values - North America, South America, Europe, Middle East, Asia Pacific. | . ERP Accounting Code | Free text | No | You can enter ERP accounting code for the partner. | . Partner Entity Name | Free text | Yes | Enter partner's entity name. | . Partner Entity Tax Identification Number | Free text | Yes | Enter the tax number for partner entity's verification. | . Partner Entity Category | Selection | Yes | Category could have following values - Domestic & International. | . Address Line 1 | Free text | Yes | Enter the address of the partner's entity. | . Address Line 2 | Free text | No | Enter the address of the partner's entity. | . Postal Code | Number | Yes | Enter the area code of the partner's entity address. | . State | Free text | Yes | Enter the state to which the partner's entity address belongs to. | . City | Free text | Yes | Enter the city to which the partner's entity address belongs to. | . Country | Selection | Yes | Zone could have following values - United States of America, Hong Kong. | . Partner Short Code | Free text | Yes | User should enter a short code that can be used to identify the partner. It should be in captial letter always. | . Alliance Program | Selection | No | Alliance Program could have following values - Star Alliance, One World, Skyteam. | . Contact Name | Free Text | Yes | Enter the name of the person to whom we have to contact. | . Contact Designation | Free text | Yes | Enter the designation of the contacted person. | . Contact No | Number | Yes | Enter the phone number of the person whom we have to contact. | . Contact Email | Email | Yes | Enter the email id of the person whom we have to contact. | . Partner Entity | Free text | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the partner entity and it will show you the result based on that. | . Contact Role | Selection | Yes | Contact Role could have following values - Partner, Plaza. | .

46.content: Pincode . You can onboard new pincode manually or import complete file containing list of pincode and their details. Also, edit existing pincode details in the system for futher use. . "Pincode" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the pincode. . . You can search for the pincode by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular pincode including pincode , country name,country ISO code, state name, city name, region. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . You can also add new pincode by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new pincode in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Pincode | Number | Yes | You have to fill this yourself. | . Country Name | Free Text | Yes | you can fill it yourself. | . Country ISO Code | None | No | System generated once you select country Name. | . State Name | Free text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . City Name | Free Text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Region | Free text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Status | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select partner name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Status could have following values - Active, Inactive | .

47.title: Product
47.content: Product . You can add new products manually or import complete file containing list of products and their details. Also, edit existing product's details in the system for futher use. . "Products" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the products. . . You can search for the product(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find products list in the table. . . You can edit/delete the particular product from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular contact. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular product information. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular product including product name, type, currency, loyalty, description, etc. . . Also, you can see one horizontal tab in the details page below the form fields - Products Available At. . . By default "Products Available At" data is visible, where you can see the which particular product is available like the names and other details of the outlet where the products is available. . . You can see the available product details and other information in the table. . . You can also add new product for multiple outlets at a time by clicking on "Add Product at Outlet" button present on the top right of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the required details to add new product. . . In "Lounge Name" field you can add multiple lounges at a time from the available option in the dropdown. . . Or, click on "Select Lounge" button to select multiple lounge after seeing their details. . . It will open a popup for you where you can see the lounges name in table. . . You can filter out the table based on the fields. Fill the input field on the basis of which you want to shortlist the table data. . . Then click on "Search" button to search the required data in the table. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . You can check the checkbox(es) for adding the multiple lounges at a time for the product. . . Click on "Select" button to select the lounges. . . Click on "Close" button to close the popup. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Add Product At Outlet" to save the details. . . You can also add new product by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new product in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Product Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the product name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you have selected any product from the dropdown, you will see some of the fields get auto filled. | . Product LA | Auto filled (view only) | - | Once you have entered the product name, the product LA will automatically got filled and disabled. | . Product Type | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Goods & Services. | . Product Category | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Category could have following values - Food, Drinks. | . Currency | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Currency could have following values - USD, YEN. | . Product Price | Number | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You can also change the price of the product by entering its current amount. | . Loyalty Points | Number | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You can give loyalty point on purchase/take on each product or services. | . Applicable Tax | Number | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. User can change the tax for each product. | . Is Active | Switch(toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | . Fulfilled By | Free text with dropdown | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You have to enter starting three alphabets of the fulfilled by and it will show you the result based on that. | . Service Time(in Hours) | Number | Yes | System generated once you select product name. Also, you can fill it yourself. User can change the service time to deliver the product/service. | . Product Description | Free text | Yes | You can set the description for each product so that anyone got to know about it easily. | . Outlet Name | Selection(Multiple value) | Yes | You can select multiple outlets at a time to make the product available at. | . Product Name | Free text | Yes | Enter the product name. | . Price | Number | Yes | Enter the price of the product you are adding. | . Currency | Dropdown | Yes | Currency could have following values - USD, YEN. | . Unit of Measure | Selection | Yes | Unit of Measure could have following values - Kg, Pound. | . Tax | Number | Yes | Enter the amount to be charged as a tax on the product. | . Is Available | Switch (Toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | .

Also, edit existing role's details in the system for futher use. . "Role" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the roles. . . You can search for the role(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find roles list in the table. . . You can edit the particular role from the system by double clicking on the respective row of the table. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular role including role name, role short name, role description. . . Also, you can see two horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Allow Module Action and Deny Module Action. . . By default "Allow Module Action" data is visible, where you can see the table of allow module action. . . You can also allow new module action by clicking on "Add New Action For Allow" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to allow new module action in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Action button" to save the data. . . Click on "Deny Module Action" tab to view deny module action information. . . You can also add new deny action by clicking on "Add New Action For Deny" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to deny new module action in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Add Action" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Save" to save the data. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Role Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the module name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you select module name it will auto fill some fields like Action Short Name, Action Descriptio, Action Url. You have to fill that too. | .
