Module Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the module name and it will show you the result based on that. | .

53.title: Security matrix
53.content: Security matrix . Data given on this page tells us that which role can use specific function of specific module. . Roles . Given below is name of roles and defination of these roles. . Role's Name Defination . GSO(Ground Staff Officer) | "GSO is lounge(outlet) staff login for accessing the WAS Client for the Operations.This is lounge staff login for accessing the WAS Client for the Operations.Login is specific to each outlet. The clients and services entitled for each outlet are controlled by LMS Admin side (i.e. “LMS BOS”)" | . Lounge Manager | Lounge Manager login for accessing the WAS Client. Lounge Manager has the access to void the transaction and to readmit the customer | . Local Sales -AI creator | This login is used by local sales team to create AIs for local clients. Only local outlets and regions could be selected (e.g. Malaysia local sales login can select Malaysia and Singapore outlets only | . Region Sales-AI creator | "This login is for regional clients and AIs creation, used by HK Sales Team. All outlet locations could be selected" | . Finance | This login is used for finance department for Reconciliation purpose,correct billing reports and to see transactional data. | . BUH (Business Unit head) -Approver | This login is used to approve/reject submitted Admission Instructions. | . Admin (Super user) | This login is used for giving user's permissions(roles)/outlet access making user inactive if (needed). | . Partner . Partner is a business entity that has signed up a contract with Plaza lounge Business to allow its customers enjoy the lounge privileges. Entity added to the LMS system may have a parent entity.Partner can be any bank, airlines, corporates, OTA etc. . Function Name Defination GSO(Ground Staff Officer) Lounge Manager Local Sales -AI creator Region Sales-AI creator Finance BUH (Business Unit head) -Approver Admin (Super user) . New | To create new partner in the system. When ever there is new deal signed between PLAZA and any partner the new partner entity or the sub entity created/on board in the BOS (3.0). | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Import | To import multiple/different partners In the system.Import functionality is used to create or update new/same set of records/data from existing system to the new system via xls. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . View/Search | To view the existing partners in the system.If the user wants to search any particular partner details out of the existing ones then user can search on the basis of partner name. | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | . Advance Search | To search the existing partners in the system based on search filters(partner name,type,categoryand status) | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Edit | In case partner details needs to be updated like address, contact number etc then user can Edit the partner information. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Delete | To delete the existing partner.In case PLAZA does not have active deal with the partner, user can delete that partner from the BOS. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Generate AI | Able to download the report in pdf format, gives hollistic view what all Admission Instructions are supported by the partner, its associated entitlements and on which outlets they are applicable. NOTE: User is able to download only in case Admission Instructions are set up for that partner. | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Outlet . An outlet is a physical location which is used to provide various services and facilities for the guests. Each outlet has the staff, equipment, and features that provide a set of services to the guests. The outlets can be owned by plaza group and operated by plaza group also, or they could be owned by a third party and operated by Plaza group using its processes, systems and staff. . Function Name Defination GSO(Ground Staff Officer) Lounge Manager Local Sales -AI creator Region Sales-AI creator Finance BUH (Business Unit head) -Approver Admin (Super user) . New | To create new Outlet/Sub Outlet in the system.Once the floorplan of any outlet location has been decided by PLAZA then that oultet needs to be created in LMS3.0 BOS. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Import | To import multiple/different outlets In the system.Import functionality is used to create or update new/same set of records/data from existing system to the new system via xls. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . View/Search | To view the existing outlets in the system.If the user wants to search any particular Outlet details out of the existing ones then user can search on the basis of Outlet name. | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | . Advance Search | To search the existing outlets in the system based on search filters(outlet name, type,category,address1&2,status) | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Edit | To edit the existing outlet data.In case Operation team of PLAZA needs to update operating hours of any outlet or to make an outlet non operational due to some renovation then user is allowed to edit and update the details. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Generate AI | Able to download the report in pdf format,Hollistic view what all Admission Instructions are mapped to any outlet. | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Product . Product are the Services/Goods available at the Outlet. Services can be lounge access,spa & shower service. Goods are the food items, beverages etc. . Function Name Defination GSO(Ground Staff Officer) Lounge Manager Local Sales -AI creator Region Sales-AI creator Finance BUH (Business Unit head) -Approver Admin (Super user) . New | To create new Product.Whenever there is a new product being launched by PLAZA or existing products needs to be available at different outlets that needs to be created in LMS 3.0 BOS | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Import | To import multiple/different products(services and goods) In the system.Import functionality is used to create or update new/same set of records/data from existing system to the new system via xls. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . View/Search | To view the existing products in the system.If the user wants to search any particular product details out of the existing ones then user can search on the basis of Product name. | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | . Advance Search | To search the existing partners in the system based on search filters(Product name,type,currency and type) | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Edit | To edit the existing product data. In case Sales team of PLAZA needs to update product information like its price/currency or on which outlet it is available at then user is allowed to edit and update the details. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Delete | To delete the existing product.In case product that is being offered at PLAZA lounges is no more available then user can delete the product from the BOS. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Admission Instruction . Each partner provides different types of tokens or identifiers that group the incoming guests from the partner. The token is presented at the outlet, and the staff keys in the token to check and validate the entitlements for the guests based on the token. When a new partner is on board they provide a token list and details to the sales staff on how to identify the guests. . Function Name Defination GSO(Ground Staff Officer) Lounge Manager Local Sales -AI creator Region Sales-AI creator Finance BUH (Business Unit head) -Approver Admin (Super user) . New | To create new Admission Instruction(for e.g credit/debit card,boarding pass,etc) in the BOS.User sets the identification pattern depending upon the type of admisison token like in case of credit card BIN range is set up and in case of boarding pass Travel class and airline code.User is able to add the entitlements for the newly created Admission Instruction. Entitlements, basically defines which token can be used to get what product or service at each of the outlets. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . View/Search | To view the existing Admission Instruction in the system.If the user wants to search any particular Admission Instruction out of the existing ones then user can search on the basis of Admission Instruction name. | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | . Advance Search | To search the existing Admission Instruction in the system based on search filters(Admission Instruction name,type,category and partner name) | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Edit | To edit the exsiting Admission Instruction details. In case user needs to update Admission Instruction details like adding more applicable outlets or BIN range pattern needs to be modify then user is allowed to edit and update the details. NOTE if the token is in DRAFT state then its editable, once approved non-editable. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Generate AI | Able to download the report in pdf format,Hollistic view of the Admission Instruction entitements, BIN range and it is applicable to what all outlets. | No | No | Yes | Yes | No | Yes | No | . Update | Only the Approved token can be updated in case the user wants to update the T&C or append the outlet list (in case of newly opened outlets) | No | No | No | No | No | Yes | No | . Activate/Deactivate | Only the approved token can be set as Deactivate in case Partner Says no more Admissions should be granted on this partcular Admission Instruction if presented by the guest to the GSO.In case user wants to activate it again then it can also be done. | No | No | No | No | No | Yes | No | . Approve/reject | Newly created Admission Instruction are submitted for the approval/rejection. Note: only the approved Admission Instructions can be binded to the partner contract. | No | No | No | No | No | Yes | No | . Partner Contract: . The partner contract defines the operational and commercial framework for allowing customers of the partner to enjoy the services of PPG lounges at preferential rates which includes complimentary access as well. . Function Name Defination GSO(Ground Staff Officer) Lounge Manager Local Sales -AI creator Region Sales-AI creator Finance BUH (Business Unit head) -Approver Admin (Super user) . New | To create new partner contract which is an agreement between the PLAZA and the partner. So the approved Admission Instructions can be mapped to the partner contract. | No | No | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | No | . View/Search | To view the existing partner contract in the system.If the user wants to search any particular partner contract out of the existing ones then user can search on the basis of partner name. | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | Yes | . 54.title: Setup New Admission Instruction
54.content: Setup New Admission Instruction . To setup new Admission Instruction, you should have Partner, Outlet and Product in the sytem. To create any of these, please refer to the steps given below. . Create Partner: First navigate to Partner screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Partner. To know more about Partner screen in detail, please click here. . Create Outlet: First navigate to Outlet screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Outlet. To know more about Outlet screen in detail, please click here. . Create Product: First navigate to Product screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Product. To know more about Product screen in detail, please click here. . Create Admission Instruction: Now go to the system and navigate to Admission Instruction screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Token. Once added you can see your token in the list. To know more about Admisson Token screen, please click here. . Create Partner Contract: To create Partner Contract, please navigate to Partner Contract section under Master menu. Create a new Partner Contract by click on New button and after successful operation, Token will be ready for admission. For more details about Partner Contract, please click here. .

55.title: Tax
55.content: Tax . You can add new Tax manually or import complete file containing list of tax and their details. Also, edit existing tax details in the system for futher use. . "Tax" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the tax. . . You can search for the tax(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find tax list in the table. . . You can edit the particular tax from the system by double click on the row of table . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular tax including tax name, tax category, and applicable on. . . Also, you can see one horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Tax Component. . . By default "Tax Component" data is visible, where you can see the table of tax component . . . You can edit/add the particular tax from the system by double click row of the table . . If you have double click on row then you can see the details of that particular tax component like component name,effective rate and display rate. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Componnent" button to add the new tax component. . . Click on "save" button to save the new tax component. . . You can also add new tax by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new tex in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Tax Name | Free text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Short Name | Free text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Tax Category | selection | Yes | You can select it yourself. | . Applicable on | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select tax name. Also, you can fill it yourself. | . Country | Selection | Yes | It show the list of Country.You can select it yourself. | . Status | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Status could have following values - Active, Inactive | . Component Name | Free text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Effective Rate | Number | Yes | You ca fill it yourself. | . Display Rate | Number | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | .

56.title: Token
56.content: Token . You can check the token list with its each and every detail which have been placed till date. . "Token" tab is accessiable from the sidebar. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the orders. . . You can search for the token(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find token in the table. . . On first Screen "WhiteList" tokens is visible . . . On the right side of the token, click on the blacklist button you can see this token is on the blacklist . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular token including reason and Comments. . . Click on "Close" button to close the populate window . . . Click on "Save" button to save the details. . . YOU can back to the "WhiteList" token screen, by clicking on the WhiteList button on right-hand side. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular token including quota,start date and end date. . . Click on "Close" button to close the populate window . . . Click on "Save" button to save the details. . .

57.title: Update Coupon
57.content: Update Coupon . This API allows publisher/partner to update coupon by using the parameters mentioned below: . { "PublicKey": "p9XEH8C1mMZk6eA ", "Token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..1SfyREf-n_idCgpmI8n1nSXy-9CJsdVVoMnC7KWChSk", "CouponID": "ag9mHIIB08nqgq7OyMd2", "ClientCode": "CM000000000000000684", "CardCode": "CR000000000000001605", "ServiceCode": "SV100000000000000057", "LastName": "Rishabh", "FirstName": "Pandey", "MiddleName": "" } . Request URL . POST: https://dev-us-lms-backendapi.plaza-network.com/api/fe/Coupon/UpdateCoupon . Parameters Description . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . publicKey | String | Mandatory* | | . CouponId | String | Mandatory* | This is unique id of coupon which user want to cancel. | . Token | string | Mandatory* | This is token which is generated when user login into system. | . ClientCode | String | Mandatory* | | . CardCode | string | Mandatory* | | . ServiceCode | string | Mandatory* | | . LastName | string | Mandatory* | This is user's last name. | . FirstName | string | Mandatory* | This is user's first name. | . MiddleName | string | Optional* | This is user's middle name. | . Responses . Success: . { "tag": " /v1/api/plaza/lms/mapOutlets", "input": { "partner": "Capital One", "outletCode": "HGN", "partnerOutletId": "Campu Token" }, "status": 1, "result": { "loungePartnerLink": { "_id": "625d4e7e2e6088fe884ed212", "partnerID": { "_id": "625574c4f0b6a02ef1bec7d2", "name": "Capital One" }, "loungeID": "624304ac1db50c6abd8667c3", "partnerLoungeID": "Campu Token", "createdBy": "61efae1b6015051f1988fa92", "createdOn": "2022-04-18T11:41:50.469Z", "lastModifiedBy": { "_id": "62b5963ef88a77058c34bff3", "name": "buh" }, "lastModifiedOn": "2022-07-15T07:57:39.954Z", "status": 1, "__v": 0 } }, "description": "Lounge Partner Link Successfully" } .

58.title: Users
58.content: Users . You can add new users manually or import complete file containing list of users and their details. Also, edit existing user's details in the system for futher use. . "Users" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the users. . . You can search for the user(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find users list in the table. . . You can edit/delete the particular user from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular user. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular user information. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular users including users name, mobile number, email, status, etc. . . Also, you can see two horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Roles, Outlet Access. . . By default "Roles" data is visible, where you can see all the roles available for accessing the system. . . You can see some checkbox(es) are selected in the first column are those roles which have been assigned to the user. . . You can also check/uncheck the checkbox(es) according to your requirement. Only checked checkboxes roles are assigned to user. . . Click on "Save" button to save the changes. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the changes done. . . Click on "Outlet Access" tab to view, edit or new add outlet for user. . . You can find the table of existing outlets. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . You can filter out the list by giving input in the form. . . Then, click on "Search" button to filter out the result in table. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the input fields and table. . . You can see some checkbox(es) are selected in the first column are those outlets which user can access or part of it. . . You can also check/uncheck the checkbox(es) according to your requirement. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset edited information. . . Click on "Add User To Outlet" to save the edited information. . . You can also add new outlet for user by clicking on "Add User To Outlet" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the form using which you can filter out the table on the basis of input you have entered. . . Click on "Search" button to filter out the table. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the input fields. . . You will see the table in which you can select the checkbox(es) for selecting or adding the outlet for user. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the table. . . Click on "Add User To Outlet" to save the data. . . You can also add new user in the system by clicking on "New" button on the top right of the main screen. . . Fill the following information and then assign role by selecing checkbox(es) in the table. . . Assign roles to user by checking checkbox in the table. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . User Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the user name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you have selected any user from the dropdown or write its name, you will see some of the fields get auto filled. | . User Type | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Plaza, Partner. | . Default Outlet Access | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You have to enter starting three alphabets of the oulet and it will show you the result based on that. | . Mobile Number | Number | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Enter the phone of the user. | . Email | Email | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Enter the email id of the user. | . Business Line | Number | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Lounge. | . Remore User ID | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You can give user id as you want. | . Is Active | Switch(toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | . Roles | Checkbox(es) | Yes | Check the checkbox(es) which role(s) you want to give to the user and it is present in the first column of each row in the table. | . Outlet Access | Checkbox(es) | Yes | Check the checkbox(es) which outlet(s) access you want to give to the user and it is present in the first column of each row in the table. | .

59.title: Vendor
59.content: Vendor . You can onboard new vendor manually or import complete file containing list of vendor and their details. Also, edit existing vendor's details in the system for futher use. . "Vendor" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the venders. . . You can search for the vendor(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find vendors list in the table. . . You can edit/delete the particular vendor from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular vendor. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular vendors information. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular vendor including vendor name, type, category, tax identification number, status, vendor short Code ,region etc. . . Also, you can see two horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Vendor Entities and Vendor Contacts. . . By default "Vendor Entities" data is visible, where you can see the table of vendor entities. . . You can edit/delete the particular entity from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular entity. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular entities information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Entity" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new entity by clicking on "Add Entity" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to add new entity in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Save button" to save the data. . . Click on "Vendor Contact" tab to view vendor contact information. . . You can edit/delete the particular contact from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular contact. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular contact information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Contact" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new vendor by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new vendor in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Vendors Settings" button to view/edit the settings. . . The popup will open for you where you can view/edit the vendors settings. . . Click on "Close" button to close the popup. . . Click on "Save" button to save the save the edited information. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Vendor Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the vendor name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you select vendor name it will auto fill some fields like Vendor Type, Vendor Category, Tax Identification number, Vendor Short Code, Status and also open Vendor Entity and contact forms. You have to fill that too. | . Vendor Type | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Financial Institution, Corporated, Lounge Programs. | . Vendor Category | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Category could have following values - Global,Local and Regional. | . Tax Identification No | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. | . Status | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Status could have following values - Active, Inactive | . Vendor Short Code | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Code should be in captial letters always. | . Region | Selection | No | Region could have following values - North America, South America, Europe, Middle East, Asia Pacific. | . ERP Accounting Code | Free text | No | You can enter ERP accounting code for the vendor. | . Uploaded Logo | Choose File | Yes | Vendor can upload logo . | . Vendor Entity Name | Free text | Yes | Enter vendor's entity name. | . Vendor Tin | Free text | Yes | Enter the Tin number for vendor entity's verification. | . Vendor Entity Category | Selection | Yes | Category could have following values - Global,Local and Regional. | . Address Line 1 | Free text | Yes | Enter the address of the vendor's entity. | . Address Line 2 | Free text | No | Enter the address of the vendor's entity. | . Postal Code | Number | Yes | Enter the area code of the vendor's entity address. | . State | Free text | Yes | Enter the state to which the vendor's entity address belongs to. | . City | Free text | Yes | Enter the city to which the vendor's entity address belongs to. | . Country | Selection | Yes | Zone could have following values - United States of America, Hong Kong. | . Vendor Short Code | Free text | Yes | User should enter a short code that can be used to identify the vendor. It should be in captial letter always. | . Alliance Program | Selection | No | Alliance Program could have following values - Star Alliance, One World, Skyteam. | . Contact Name | Free Text | Yes | Enter the name of the person to whom we have to contact. | . Contact Designation | Free text | Yes | Enter the designation of the contacted person. | . Contact No | Number | Yes | Enter the phone number of the person whom we have to contact. | . Contact Email | Email | Yes | Enter the email id of the person whom we have to contact. | . Vendor Entity | Free text | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the vendor entity and it will show you the result based on that. | . Contact Role | Selection | Yes | Contact Role could have following values - Partner, Plaza. | .

60.title: Verify Token
60.content: Verify Token . This API allows publisher/partner to verify token by using the parameters mentioned below: . { "tokenType": 1, "tokenCode": "62d542fbf8c55f12a572a4cf" } . Request URL . POST: https://dev-us-lms-backendapi.plaza-network.com/api/fe/v1/admission/verifytoken . Parameters Description . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . tokenType | Option | Mandatory* | This is token type that user has to verify. | . tokenCode | String | Mandatory* | This is unique token code for which user has to verify token. | . Responses . Success: . [ { "tokenInfo": { "locationID": "624304ac1db50c6abd8667c3", "thirdPartyLocationCode": "", "clientID": "62c9be68d7a06f370670ff5a", "clientType": 1, "clientName": "Citi Bank", "tokenID": "62ccf778a76e36fe02dd334a", "tokenName": "Citi Bank Token", "tokenImages": [ "https://trangile-ppg-lms.s3-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/3200/3100/token-sample/58c79c4f-a217-4ff4-8bc4-da44d2e272be.png" ], "tokenType": 1, "tokenCode": "62d542fbf8c55f12a572a4cf", "tokenExpireDate": "/", "tokenHolderName": null, "integrationCode": "" }, "aiDetailID": "", "aiServices": [ { "serviceID": "62ccf7b5c65fbb0c6d4a963e", "serviceName": "lounge usage", "isPrimary": true, "quota": 1, "needPay": false, "currencyCode": "HKD", "price": 0, "usedQty": 0, "remark": "", "duration": 1 } ], "isBoardingPassMandatory": true, "thirdPartyRefNo": "", "isQuotaHandleByThirdParty": false } ] .

61.title: Whitelisted Token
61.content: Whitelisted Token . This API allows publisher/partner to get whitelisted token by using the parameters mentioned below: . { "token": 234568777788, "tokenType": "Vouchers", "quota": 10, "startDate":"08-03-2022", "endDate":"08-04-2022" } . Request URL . POST: https://dev-us-lms-backendapi.plaza-network.com/api/fe/v1/plaza/lms/whitelistedToken . Parameters Description . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . token | Number | Mandatory* | User can get details only about specifin token. This is created at the time of admission. | . Token type | Options | Mandatory* | Tells you the type of admission it is, like QR code, credit card, boarding pass. | . Quota | Number | Mandatory* | Number of quota this token has. | . startDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order starting from the mentioned date. | . endDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order till the mentioned date. | . Responses . Success: . { "status": 0, "tag": " /v1/api/plaza/lms/whitelistedToken", "input": { "token": 234568777788, "tokenType": "Vouchers", "quota": 10, "startDate": "08-03-2022", "endDate": "08-04-2022" }, "result": "", "description": "token could not found" } .

62.title: Guest Admission
62.content: Guest Admission . On the visit to the lounge, guest will have to present his Admission Instruction to GSO. Admission Instruction is entered in the system to check certain parameters. First system identifies the entitlements to the token and its partnen then subsequent checks follow. . Blacklisting check: System checks if the Given card number restricted for admisson. Please contact issuing bank. or not. If found blacklisted, guest is not allowed to the lounge. If not blacklisted, system moves to the next check. . Partner Contract check: A valid Partner Contract is also checked in the system. If a valid Partner Contract is not found against the system, guest is not allowed. If the Partner Contract is valid, it moves to the next steps. . Consumption quota check: System checks for comsumption quota in the database and see if guest is still left with entitlements to the token. If nothing is available in quota, guest is not allowed to the lounge. If not, system moves to the next check. . Quota check from Partner APIs: Partner APIs are called to check for quota and entitlements. If Partner rejects the request, guest is not allowed, else system moved ahead. . Guest admission: After all these successful checks, guest is allowed to the lounge based on entitlements and token is redeemed. .
